title: wc and nl
lessonContent:
The wc (word count) command shows the total count of words in a file. 
$ wc /etc/passwd
 96     265    5925 /etc/passwd
It display the number of lines, number of words and number of bytes, respectively. To just see just the count of a certain field, use the -l, -w, or -c respectively. 
$ wc -l /etc/passwd
96
Another command you can use to check the count of lines on a file is the nl (number lines) command. 
file1.txt
i
like
turtles

$ nl file1.txt
1. i
2. like
3. turtles
exercise: How would you get the total count of lines by using the nl file without searching through the entire output? Hint: Use some of the other commands you learned in this course.
quizQuestion: What command would you use to get the total number of words in a file and just the words?
